title: Bossy: Femme Powered Hip Hop + R&B Night
excerpt:
Come get sweaty on the dance floor at BOSSY, our FEMME POWERED Hip Hop and R&B dance party.
BOSSY is an inclusive dance party celebrating the talent of women/femme identified and nonbinary people in hip hop/rnb/grime. Expect to hear artists like: Missy Elliot, Beyonce, Lil Kim, Foxy Brown, Trina, Lauryn Hill, TLC, Erykah Badhu, Tinashe,MIA, Eve, Nicki Minaj, Lady, Shawnna, Candi Redd, Ciara, Dej Loaf, Lady Leshurr, Princess Nokia, Red/Double Trouble, Crime Mob/Diamond,Young M.A, Kodie Shane, Dreezy, + More. 
The Fox Cabaret (2321 Main Street)
10:30pm — 2am
19+ General Admission

title: Lost Girls Burlesque - Beltane Nocturnal

Lost Girls Burlesque - BELTANE NOCTURNAL at Fox Cabaret - Saturday May 19thSeason Finale Show - Doors @ 8pm Show at 9pm. From the sexiest depths of darkness, these deadly babes have risen to destroy the night: The Lost Girls. Presented in continuous, non-stop, hot-action format like youve NEVER seen before. In technicolour and high-definition! No emcees, no holds barred, NO MERCY! A daring exposé of flesh that will tantalize and torture even the most respectable members of society. Prepare to be ripped apart by seduction as The Lost Girls bare it all, again and again... and again. title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
excerpt:
Coastal City Ballet closes its 2017/18 season with the remount of Irene Schneider’s enchanting ballet, Shakespeare’s A Midsummer Night’s Dream, May 19 at Vancouver Playhouse and June 8 at Surrey Arts Centre. Set to the exquisite music of Felix Mendelssohn, this full-length ballet, which premiered in 2013, will showcase the prodigious talents of the Lower Mainland’s finest young dancers in their season finale.

“As we wrap up our seventh season, we are delighted to revisit German choreographer Irene Schneider’s magnificent ballet,” says Li Yaming, CCB Artistic Director. “For this production, translating the elegance of Shakespeare’s language into the joyous, expressive form that is dance, we are thrilled to welcome back a number of our gradua

title: The Lone Palms + Guests
excerpt: Live Acts Canada + The Live Agency presents: The Lone Palms with special guests Harlequin Gold, Blue J and Okay MannThe Lone Palms (Vancouver) // A group of wandering vagabonds that stumbled into Vancouver, BC, and never left. Alex Cooper, Dave Comrie and Dan Cerino draw from a mutual love of 60's and 70's rock. Inspired by the carefree, cross country drawl of artists like Neil Young, America, the Eagles as well as the frenetic stylings of artists such as E.L.O, The Creation, Queens of the Stone Age and Ben Caplan. Having formed their musical identities through years of session work, drunken jams, broken bands and good time playlists the group now feel more confident than ever to make the music they’ve always wanted. title: The Room
excerpt:
And truly, truly, the best (trust!) way to experience this “masterpiece” is in the dark, on the big screen, and with a packed audience of confused (and enthused!) lovers of director Tommy Wiseau‘s bizarre cinematic oddity that has morphed into a pop-culture phenomenon. Also: #spoons. Audience costumes welcome and encouraged!!!
Saturday, May 19THE ROOMDoors 10:15 pm | Movie 11:00 pm
Tickets $12 advance HERE | $14 at the door
*Must be 19+ w/ID for entry and bar service
**Rio Theatre Groupons and passes OK! Please redeem at the door.
***Audience costumes welcome – and encouraged! (Don’t forget to bring your spoons…)

title: Game Night
excerpt: Jason Bateman and Rachel McAdams star as Max and Annie, whose weekly couples game night gets kicked up a notch when Max’s charismatic brother, Brooks (Kyle Chandler), arranges a murder mystery party, complete with fake thugs and faux federal agents. So when Brooks gets kidnapped, it’s all part of the game–right? But as the six uber-competitive gamers set out to solve the case and win, they begin to discover that neither this game–nor Brooks–are what they seem to be. Over the course of one chaotic night, the friends find themselves increasingly in over their heads as each twist leads to another unexpected turn. With no rules, no points, and no idea who all the players are, this could turn out to be the most fun they’ve ever had… or game over.

title: Grace Jones: Bloodlight and Bami
excerpt: This electrifying journey through the public and private worlds of pop culture mega-icon Grace Jones contrasts musical sequences with intimate personal footage, all the while brimming with Jones’s bold aesthetic. A larger-than-life entertainer, an androgynous glam-pop diva, an unpredictable media presence – Grace Jones is all these things and more. Sophie Fiennes’ documentary goes beyond the traditional music biography, offering a portrait as stylish and unconventional as its subject. Taking us home with her to Jamaica, into the studio with long-time collaborators Sly & Robbie, and backstage at gigs around the world, the film reveals Jones as lover, daughter, mother, and businesswoman. But the stage is the fixed point to which the film retur

title: My Neighbor Totoro
excerpt:
There is no better way to appreciate the magic of Studio Ghibli than on the big screen!
Movie-lovers of all ages adore the wonderful colletction from Japan’s famed Studio Ghibli, and Hayao Miyazaki‘s “breakthrough” film MY NEIGHBOUR TOTORO (1988) is one of their most popular titles This heartwarming and sentimental tale about sisters Satsuki and Mei encountering a mythical forest sprite and its woodland companions when they move to rural Japan is perfect for movie-lovers of all ages – minors very welcome in the balcony!
“An otherworldly tale of childhood and a definitive work of imagination.” (Empire Magazine)
“One of the finest family films ever made.” (Film4)
Sunday, May 13 *This screening is the English dub
Doors 12:45 pm | Movie 1:15 pmT

title: Impressions Of Lightfoot
excerpt: Last year, drummer James McRae re-envisioned Gordon Lightfoot’s iconic songbook collaborating with fellow jazz luminaries Rene Worst bass, Jennifer Scott vocals and Miles Black piano. The resulting recording, Impressions of Lightfoot, is filled with fresh and innovative interpretations of his music. The group performed the tunes to a sold out crowd at Frankie’s Jazz Club last fall. For this performance Bill Coon is stepping in for Miles Black.

title: Craft and the Furious
excerpt: Are your favorite things Crafts, Comedy, and a movie franchise that's basically people with muscles, who's superpower is that they're good with cars? Even if only one of these is your jam, you'll have a fun weird time at Little Mountain Gallery.We've got some of the city's funniest people to chat while a certain movie about cars plays (legally I'm just going to avoid saying what it is, but like, you know what it will be).While we make jokes, we encourage you to bring a craft project to do during the show, and we can also chat about that!Let's say you don't have a craft project, well you're in luck. title: Umetsugu Inoue: Japan’s Music Man
excerpt:
MAY 19-20, 26-27
“A director who had a big impact on Japanese and Hong Kong pop cinema ... Inoue’s mix of music, action, and hot young talent became a template for a new genre, called Nikkatsu Action.”
MARK SCHILLING, VARIETY
“I’m a drummer, a no-good drummer / When I get mad, I start a storm.”
YUJIRO ISHIHARA, SINGING IN THE STORMY MAN
Although the prolific Japanese filmmaker Umetsugu Inoue made movies in a number of genres, he may be best known as a specialist in musicals. He began making youth-oriented musicals in the 1950s at Nikkatsu, the influential Japanese genre-cinema studio that launched the career of cult favourite Seijun Suzuki. (Suzuki was the subject of a Cinematheque retrospective in 2016; Nikkatsu productions were themselves

title: BloodFeud: Standup VS Improv
excerpt: A monthly show on the third Saturday at Little Mountain Gallery where Standup Comedians and Improvisers battle it out for comedy glory.In the first half, we've got a lineup of some of Vancouver's best stand ups who have been making the rounds in the dark and dank rooms in Vancouver applying their craft to whoever is will tolerate them. The stand ups, who have honed their jokes until they are perfect, come to the Bloodfeud stage to show you what meticulous hard work and dedication can do.In the second half, a group of happy-go-lucky and "uppity" improvisers, representing the major Improv hubs of Vancouver, and having done nothing to prepare for the night, hit the stage. Using the hard work of the stand ups as their inspiration, the improviser

He has a deep love of funk, disco, nu-wave,synth-pop, post punk, and underground house. His aim is for a diverse range of sounds and he has a healthy disrespect of style conformity. The Vancouver Swing Society firmly believes that any and every body can learn to follow and/or lead, regardless of age, gender expression, ability, and any other aspect of identity. title: Deva Premal & Miten with Manose May 2018 The Soul of Mantra
excerpt:
Paul Mercs Concerts is pleased to present celebrated chant masters Deva Premal & Miten with Manose, who will be accompanied by Joby Baker & Rishi. 
Deva Premal & Miten have traveled the world for 20 years, sharing the healing power of mantras. The unique blend of Deva’s voice, the ancient Sanskrit chants, Miten’s soulful songs and Manose’s sacred flute offers audiences an evening of peace and transformation.
Nepalese bansuri maestro, Manose – acknowledged as among the world’s best – accompanies as always Deva Premal & Miten both on flute, vocals and various instruments, including ukulele.
The SOUL OF MANTRA – LIVE tour is augmented by Canadian Joby Baker on bass, vocals and keyboards and Danish percussionist, Rishi. Together, this unique ens

title: All British Field Meet ABFM 2018
excerpt:
The 33rd showing of the Greatest Show on British Wheels returns to VanDusen Botanical Garden on the Victoria Day weekend.
The largest show of its kind in Western Canada displaying 450 British built classics reflecting the history and automotive culture from the pre-war era through to the late 1970. Stay tuned for more details and visit http://www.westerndriver.com for other information.

title: Bhakti, Nada Yoga + Deep Listening with Tina James
excerpt:
Spend an afternoon with one of our dearest teachers, mother, activist and dedicated yogini Tina Pashumati James. Sharing wisdom surrounding Patanjali’s Yoga Sutras, Upanishads, The Bhagavad Gita, we will enjoy an afternoon chanting holy mantra, “Bija Meditation" + yoga nidra.
She will offer a wild, Shamanic drum circle evolving consciousness, and deep healing vibrations. Coming together to raise the vibration for ourselves and our beloved planet. In society we have the tendency not to inhabit our bodies. To create alignment between the mind, heart and spirit we must inhabit the body. Drumming is a fundamental way to get back into our bodies, connect with our heart and connect with the group.
This afternoon will be a journey of devotion + com
